Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien

wikitext.*:
[[Image:Miss Kilbride 24 December 1938.png|thumb]]
On [[24 December]] [[1938]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Miss Kilbride''' (Katherine or Kitty), a friend and former student.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienguide.com/modules/wordpress/archives/272|articlename=Tolkien Handwritten Postcard For Auction - Bonhams 12 June 2012|dated=29 May 2012|website=Guide|accessed=2 June 2012}}</ref>

*'''Subject:''' Personal greetings. News of the hardships suffered that year and of his family, and complaining abut the state of Oxford in the age of Morris Motors.<ref name=Bonhams>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.bonhams.com/auctions/20137/lot/150/|articlename=Auction 20137: Lot 150: Tolkien, J.R.R.|dated=|website=[http://www.bonhams.com/ Bonhams.com]|accessed=2 June 2012}}</ref>
*'''Description:''' Postcard (reproducing in colours [[Josef Madlener]]'s Heilige Familie), one page, closely written in a minute hand.<ref name=Bonhams/>
*'''Publication:''' A reproduction of and quotes from the letter appeared in the auction catalogue ''[[Bonhams Books, Maps, Manuscripts and Historical Photographs 12 June 2012]]''.
==External link==
* [https://tolkienlibrary.com/tolkien-book-store/clp0508.php Pictures of the postcard] on TolkienLibrary.com
